I haven't seen that effect and don't have any immediate theories as to 
why a proxy might help. The crawler typically does not visit the same 
URIs twice, so there's no expected speedup from caching. Perhaps in your 
specific local network, the proxy had access to more inbound bandwidth 
than the originating machine?

In general, I wouldn't expect sending crawler traffic through a proxy 
would accelerate crawling -- though it is a configuration option on the 
FetchHTTP processor, if you want to try it.

Why you're hitting the cap you describe is likely something specific to 
your machine and network. Also, if you are only crawling one or a small 
number of sites, the path to those sites, or those sites' own 
client-throttling settings, may be the limiting factor.

- Gordon @ IA
